hints.label: def-smooth-phase-space-partition-full
hints.title: Smooth Phase-Space Partition
hints.content:
1131: :label: def-smooth-phase-space-partition-full
1132: 
1133: Fix a clustering scale $\varepsilon_c > 0$ and cluster centers $\{(y_m, u_m)\}_{m=1}^M$ in phase space.
1134: 
1135: A **smooth partition of unity** is a collection of functions $\{\psi_m : \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d \to [0,1]\}_{m=1}^M$ satisfying:
1136: 
1137: 1. **Partition identity**:
1138: 
1139: $$
1140: \sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x, v) = 1 \quad \text{for all } (x, v) \in \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d
1141: 
1142: $$
1143: 
1144: 2. **Smoothness**: Each $\psi_m \in C^\infty$ with bounded derivatives:
1145: 
1146: $$
1147: \|\nabla^n \psi_m\|_\infty \leq C_{\psi,n} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{-n} \quad \text{for all } n \geq 0
1148: 
1149: $$
1150: 
1151: 3. **Localization**: Each $\psi_m$ has support concentrated near cluster $m$:
1152: 
1153: $$
1154: \psi_m(x, v) = 0 \quad \text{when } d_{\text{alg}}((x,v), (y_m, u_m)) > 2\varepsilon_c
1155: 
1156: $$
hints.raw_directive:
1128: We construct a **smooth partition of unity** on phase space that avoids the discontinuity problems of hard clustering.
1129: 
1130: :::{prf:definition} Smooth Phase-Space Partition
1131: :label: def-smooth-phase-space-partition-full
1132: 
1133: Fix a clustering scale $\varepsilon_c > 0$ and cluster centers $\{(y_m, u_m)\}_{m=1}^M$ in phase space.
1134: 
1135: A **smooth partition of unity** is a collection of functions $\{\psi_m : \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d \to [0,1]\}_{m=1}^M$ satisfying:
1136: 
1137: 1. **Partition identity**:
1138: 
1139: $$
1140: \sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x, v) = 1 \quad \text{for all } (x, v) \in \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d
1141: 
1142: $$
1143: 
1144: 2. **Smoothness**: Each $\psi_m \in C^\infty$ with bounded derivatives:
1145: 
1146: $$
1147: \|\nabla^n \psi_m\|_\infty \leq C_{\psi,n} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{-n} \quad \text{for all } n \geq 0
1148: 
1149: $$
1150: 
1151: 3. **Localization**: Each $\psi_m$ has support concentrated near cluster $m$:
1152: 
1153: $$
1154: \psi_m(x, v) = 0 \quad \text{when } d_{\text{alg}}((x,v), (y_m, u_m)) > 2\varepsilon_c
1155: 
1156: $$
1157:

hints.label: const-mollified-partition-full
hints.title: Mollified Partition via Smooth Cutoffs
hints.content:
1162: :label: const-mollified-partition-full
1163: 
1164: We construct $\psi_m$ using **smooth bump functions**:
1165: 
1166: **Step 1: Smooth cutoff function.**
1167: 
1168: Define $\phi: \mathbb{R}_{\geq 0} \to [0,1]$ by:
1169: 
1170: $$
1171: \phi(r) = \begin{cases}
1172: \exp\left(-\frac{1}{1 - (r/R)^2}\right) & \text{if } r < R \\
1173: 0 & \text{if } r \geq R
1174: \end{cases}
1175: 
1176: $$
1177: 
1178: This is C^∞ with compact support $[0, R]$ and $\phi(r) = 1$ near $r = 0$.
1179: 
1180: **Step 2: Localized bump functions.**
1181: 
1182: For cluster $m$ with center $(y_m, u_m)$, define:
1183: 
1184: $$
1185: \tilde{\psi}_m(x, v) = \phi\left(d_{\text{alg}}((x,v), (y_m, u_m)) / (2\varepsilon_c)\right)
1186: 
1187: $$
1188: 
1189: This satisfies:
1190: - $\tilde{\psi}_m \in C^\infty$ (composition of smooth functions)
1191: - $\text{supp}(\tilde{\psi}_m) \subset B((y_m, u_m), 2\varepsilon_c)$ (compact support)
1192: - $\tilde{\psi}_m \geq \exp(-1)$ on $B((y_m, u_m), \varepsilon_c)$ (positive core)
1193: 
1194: **Step 3: Normalization to partition of unity.**
1195: 
1196: Define:
1197: 
1198: $$
1199: \psi_m(x, v) = \frac{\tilde{\psi}_m(x, v)}{\sum_{m'=1}^M \tilde{\psi}_{m'}(x, v)}
1200: 
1201: $$
1202: 
1203: By construction:
1204: - $\sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m = 1$ (partition identity)
hints.raw_directive:
1159: :::
1160: 
1161: :::{prf:construction} Mollified Partition via Smooth Cutoffs
1162: :label: const-mollified-partition-full
1163: 
1164: We construct $\psi_m$ using **smooth bump functions**:
1165: 
1166: **Step 1: Smooth cutoff function.**
1167: 
1168: Define $\phi: \mathbb{R}_{\geq 0} \to [0,1]$ by:
1169: 
1170: $$
1171: \phi(r) = \begin{cases}
1172: \exp\left(-\frac{1}{1 - (r/R)^2}\right) & \text{if } r < R \\
1173: 0 & \text{if } r \geq R
1174: \end{cases}
1175: 
1176: $$
1177: 
1178: This is C^∞ with compact support $[0, R]$ and $\phi(r) = 1$ near $r = 0$.
1179: 
1180: **Step 2: Localized bump functions.**
1181: 
1182: For cluster $m$ with center $(y_m, u_m)$, define:
1183: 
1184: $$
1185: \tilde{\psi}_m(x, v) = \phi\left(d_{\text{alg}}((x,v), (y_m, u_m)) / (2\varepsilon_c)\right)
1186: 
1187: $$
1188: 
1189: This satisfies:
1190: - $\tilde{\psi}_m \in C^\infty$ (composition of smooth functions)
1191: - $\text{supp}(\tilde{\psi}_m) \subset B((y_m, u_m), 2\varepsilon_c)$ (compact support)
1192: - $\tilde{\psi}_m \geq \exp(-1)$ on $B((y_m, u_m), \varepsilon_c)$ (positive core)
1193: 
1194: **Step 3: Normalization to partition of unity.**
1195: 
1196: Define:
1197: 
1198: $$
1199: \psi_m(x, v) = \frac{\tilde{\psi}_m(x, v)}{\sum_{m'=1}^M \tilde{\psi}_{m'}(x, v)}
1200: 
1201: $$
1202: 
1203: By construction:
1204: - $\sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m = 1$ (partition identity)
1205: - Each $\psi_m \in C^\infty$ (quotient of smooth functions with non-vanishing denominator)

hints.label: lem-partition-derivative-bounds-full
hints.title: Derivative Bounds for Partition Functions
hints.content:
1210: :label: lem-partition-derivative-bounds-full
1211: 
1212: The partition functions $\psi_m$ satisfy:
1213: 
1214: $$
1215: \|\nabla^n \psi_m\|_\infty \leq C_{\psi,n} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{-n}
1216: 
1217: $$
hints.raw_directive:
1207: :::
1208: 
1209: :::{prf:lemma} Derivative Bounds for Partition Functions
1210: :label: lem-partition-derivative-bounds-full
1211: 
1212: The partition functions $\psi_m$ satisfy:
1213: 
1214: $$
1215: \|\nabla^n \psi_m\|_\infty \leq C_{\psi,n} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{-n}
1216: 
1217: $$
1218:

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-97
hints.content:
1221: 
1222: :::{prf:proof}
1223: **Step 1: Derivatives of the bump function.**
1224: 
1225: For the smooth cutoff $\phi(r)$, standard calculus gives:
1226: 
1227: $$
1228: |\phi^{(n)}(r)| \leq C_\phi \cdot n! \cdot R^{-n}
1229: 
1230: $$
1231: 
1232: where $C_\phi$ is a universal constant (Gevrey-1 bounds for smooth compactly supported functions).
1233: 
1234: **Step 2: Chain rule for $\tilde{\psi}_m$.**
1235: 
1236: Since $\tilde{\psi}_m(x,v) = \phi(d_{\text{alg}}((x,v), (y_m, u_m)) / (2\varepsilon_c))$, by Faà di Bruno formula:
1237: 
1238: $$
1239: \|\nabla^n \tilde{\psi}_m\|_\infty \leq C'_\phi \cdot n! \cdot (2\varepsilon_c)^{-n}
1240: 
1241: $$
1242: 
1243: (using $\|\nabla^j d_{\text{alg}}\|_\infty = \mathcal{O}(1)$ for $j \geq 1$ - see Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-dalg-derivative-bounds-full`).
1244: 
1245: **Step 3: Quotient rule for $\psi_m$.**
1246: 
1247: The normalized partition function:
1248: 
1249: $$
1250: \psi_m = \frac{\tilde{\psi}_m}{\sum_{m'} \tilde{\psi}_{m'}}
1251: 
1252: $$
1253: 
1254: By quotient rule, with denominator bounded below by $1$ (sum of at least one non-zero $\tilde{\psi}_{m'}$):
1255: 
1256: $$
1257: \|\nabla^n \psi_m\|_\infty \leq C_{\psi,n} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{-n}
1258: 
1259: $$
1260: 
1261: where $C_{\psi,n} = \mathcal{O}(n!)$ absorbs the combinatorial factors from the quotient rule.
hints.raw_directive:
1220: :::
1221:

1223: **Step 1: Derivatives of the bump function.**
1224:

1229: 
1230: $$
1231:

1233:

1235:

1237: 
1238: $$
1239: \|\nabla^n \tilde{\psi}_m\|_\infty \leq C'_\phi \cdot n! \cdot (2\varepsilon_c)^{-n}
1240: 
1241: $$
1242: 
1243: (using $\|\nabla^j d_{\text{alg}}\|_\infty = \mathcal{O}(1)$ for $j \geq 1$ - see Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-dalg-derivative-bounds-full`).
1244: 
1245: **Step 3: Quotient rule for $\psi_m$.**
1246:

1248:

1251: 
1252: $$
1253: 
1254: By quotient rule, with denominator bounded below by $1$ (sum of at least one non-zero $\tilde{\psi}_{m'}$):
1255: 
1256: $$
1257: \|\nabla^n \psi_m\|_\infty \leq C_{\psi,n} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{-n}
1258: 
1259: $$
1260:

1262:

hints.label: def-soft-cluster-membership-full
hints.title: Soft Cluster Membership Weights
hints.content:
1269: :label: def-soft-cluster-membership-full
1270: 
1271: For walker $j \in \mathcal{A}$, define its **soft membership** in cluster $m$ as:
1272: 
1273: $$
1274: \alpha_{j,m} = \psi_m(x_j, v_j) \in [0, 1]
1275: 
1276: $$
1277: 
1278: This satisfies:
1279: - $\sum_{m=1}^M \alpha_{j,m} = 1$ (walker belongs to all clusters with fractional weights)
hints.raw_directive:
1266: ### 3.2 Cluster Assignment via Soft Membership
1267: 
1268: :::{prf:definition} Soft Cluster Membership Weights
1269: :label: def-soft-cluster-membership-full
1270: 
1271: For walker $j \in \mathcal{A}$, define its **soft membership** in cluster $m$ as:
1272: 
1273: $$
1274: \alpha_{j,m} = \psi_m(x_j, v_j) \in [0, 1]
1275: 
1276: $$
1277: 
1278: This satisfies:
1279: - $\sum_{m=1}^M \alpha_{j,m} = 1$ (walker belongs to all clusters with fractional weights)
1280: - $\alpha_{j,m} \geq 1/2$ if $d_{\text{alg}}(j, m) \leq \varepsilon_c/2$ (strong membership near center)

hints.label: def-effective-cluster-population-full
hints.title: Effective Cluster Population
hints.content:
1289: :label: def-effective-cluster-population-full
1290: 
1291: The **effective number of walkers** in cluster $m$ is:
1292: 
1293: $$
1294: k_m^{\text{eff}} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \alpha_{j,m} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \psi_m(x_j, v_j)
1295: 
1296: $$
hints.raw_directive:
1286: ### 3.3 Effective Cluster Size
1287: 
1288: :::{prf:definition} Effective Cluster Population
1289: :label: def-effective-cluster-population-full
1290: 
1291: The **effective number of walkers** in cluster $m$ is:
1292: 
1293: $$
1294: k_m^{\text{eff}} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \alpha_{j,m} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \psi_m(x_j, v_j)
1295: 
1296: $$
1297:

hints.label: lem-effective-cluster-size-bounds-full
hints.title: Bounds on Effective Cluster Size
hints.content:
1302: :label: lem-effective-cluster-size-bounds-full
1303: 
1304: Under {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full`:
1305: 
1306: $$
1307: k_m^{\text{eff}} \leq \rho_{\max} \cdot \text{Vol}(B(y_m, 2\varepsilon_c)) = C_{\text{vol}} \cdot \rho_{\max} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{2d}
1308: 
1309: $$
1310: 
1311: where $C_{\text{vol}}$ is the volume constant for phase-space balls.
1312: 
1313: Moreover, the total effective population sums to $k$:
1314: 
1315: $$
1316: \sum_{m=1}^M k_m^{\text{eff}} = \sum_{m=1}^M \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \psi_m(x_j, v_j) = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \underbrace{\sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x_j, v_j)}_{= 1} = k
hints.raw_directive:
1299: :::
1300: 
1301: :::{prf:lemma} Bounds on Effective Cluster Size
1302: :label: lem-effective-cluster-size-bounds-full
1303: 
1304: Under {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full`:
1305: 
1306: $$
1307: k_m^{\text{eff}} \leq \rho_{\max} \cdot \text{Vol}(B(y_m, 2\varepsilon_c)) = C_{\text{vol}} \cdot \rho_{\max} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{2d}
1308: 
1309: $$
1310: 
1311: where $C_{\text{vol}}$ is the volume constant for phase-space balls.
1312: 
1313: Moreover, the total effective population sums to $k$:
1314: 
1315: $$
1316: \sum_{m=1}^M k_m^{\text{eff}} = \sum_{m=1}^M \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \psi_m(x_j, v_j) = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \underbrace{\sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x_j, v_j)}_{= 1} = k
1317:

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-196
hints.content:
1320: 
1321: :::{prf:proof}
1322: This lemma establishes uniform bounds on the effective cluster size using density bounds and geometric measure theory.
1323: 
1324: **Part 1: Upper bound via density and support**
1325: 
1326: From {prf:ref}`def-effective-cluster-population-full`, $k_m^{\text{eff}} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \psi_m(x_j, v_j)$. Since $\psi_m$ has support only within distance $2\varepsilon_c$ of cluster center $(y_m, u_m)$, only walkers in the phase-space ball $B(y_m, 2\varepsilon_c)$ contribute.
1327: 
1328: Under the uniform density bound {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full`, the number of walkers in any ball $B$ satisfies:
1329: 
1330: $$
1331: \#\{j : (x_j, v_j) \in B\} \leq \rho_{\max} \cdot \text{Vol}(B)
1332: 
1333: $$
1334: 
1335: The phase-space has dimension $2d$ (position + velocity), so:
1336: 
1337: $$
1338: \text{Vol}(B(y_m, 2\varepsilon_c)) = \frac{\pi^d}{d!} (2\varepsilon_c)^{2d} = C_{\text{vol}} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{2d}
1339: 
1340: $$
1341: 
1342: where $C_{\text{vol}} = 2^{2d} \pi^d / d!$. Therefore:
1343: 
1344: $$
1345: k_m^{\text{eff}} \leq \rho_{\max} \cdot C_{\text{vol}} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{2d}
1346: 
1347: $$
1348: 
1349: **Part 2: Total population conservation**
1350: 
1351: The partition functions satisfy $\sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x, v) = 1$ (partition of unity). Summing over all clusters:
1352: 
1353: $$
1354: \sum_{m=1}^M k_m^{\text{eff}} = \sum_{m=1}^M \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \psi_m(x_j, v_j) = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x_j, v_j) = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} 1 = k
1355: 
1356: $$
hints.raw_directive:
1319: :::
1320: 
1321: :::{prf:proof}
1322: This lemma establishes uniform bounds on the effective cluster size using density bounds and geometric measure theory.
1323: 
1324: **Part 1: Upper bound via density and support**
1325: 
1326: From {prf:ref}`def-effective-cluster-population-full`, $k_m^{\text{eff}} = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \psi_m(x_j, v_j)$. Since $\psi_m$ has support only within distance $2\varepsilon_c$ of cluster center $(y_m, u_m)$, only walkers in the phase-space ball $B(y_m, 2\varepsilon_c)$ contribute.
1327: 
1328: Under the uniform density bound {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full`, the number of walkers in any ball $B$ satisfies:
1329: 
1330: $$
1331: \#\{j : (x_j, v_j) \in B\} \leq \rho_{\max} \cdot \text{Vol}(B)
1332: 
1333: $$
1334: 
1335: The phase-space has dimension $2d$ (position + velocity), so:
1336: 
1337: $$
1338: \text{Vol}(B(y_m, 2\varepsilon_c)) = \frac{\pi^d}{d!} (2\varepsilon_c)^{2d} = C_{\text{vol}} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{2d}
1339: 
1340: $$
1341: 
1342: where $C_{\text{vol}} = 2^{2d} \pi^d / d!$. Therefore:
1343: 
1344: $$
1345: k_m^{\text{eff}} \leq \rho_{\max} \cdot C_{\text{vol}} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{2d}
1346: 
1347: $$
1348: 
1349: **Part 2: Total population conservation**
1350: 
1351: The partition functions satisfy $\sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x, v) = 1$ (partition of unity). Summing over all clusters:
1352: 
1353: $$
1354: \sum_{m=1}^M k_m^{\text{eff}} = \sum_{m=1}^M \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \psi_m(x_j, v_j) = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} \sum_{m=1}^M \psi_m(x_j, v_j) = \sum_{j \in \mathcal{A}} 1 = k
1355: 
1356: $$
1357:
